lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Topic: 1.1 The nature of the economic problem
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain the difference between book-keeping and accounting

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Topic: 1.1 The nature of the economic problem
lessons.Learning Objective: state the purposes of measuring business profit and loss

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain definitions and examples of land; labour; capital and enterprise

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the influences on the mobility of the various factors of production

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the causes of changes in the quantity and quality of the various factors of production

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain the definition and examples of opportunity cost in different contexts

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the influence of opportunity cost on decisions made by consumers; workers; producers and governments when allocating their resources

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain the definition; drawing and interpretation of appropriate diagrams

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the significance of the location of production points under; on and beyond a PPC

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand movements along a PPC and opportunity cost

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the causes and consequences of shifts in a PPC in terms of an economy's growth

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain the difference between microeconomics and macroeconomics and the decision makers involved in each

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Topic: 2.2 The role of markets in allocating resources
lessons.Learning Objective: understand how a market system works; including buyers; sellers; allocation of scarce resources; market equilibrium; and market disequilibrium

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Topic: 2.2 The role of markets in allocating resources
lessons.Learning Objective: understand that the economic problem creates three key questions about determining resource allocation - what to produce; how; and for whom

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Topic: 2.2 The role of markets in allocating resources
lessons.Learning Objective: understand how the price mechanism provides answers to the key allocation questions

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain the definition; drawing and interpretation of appropriate diagrams

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: draw and use a demand curve to illustrate movements along a demand curve with appropriate terminology

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the link between individual and market demand in terms of aggregation

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the causes of shifts in a demand curve with appropriate terminology

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain the definition; drawing and interpretation of appropriate diagrams

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: draw and use a supply curve to illustrate movements along a supply curve with appropriate terminology

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the link between individual and market supply in terms of aggregation

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the causes of shifts in a supply curve with appropriate terminology

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain the definition; drawing and interpretation of demand and supply schedules and curves used to establish equilibrium price and sales in a market

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain the definition; drawing and interpretation of demand and supply schedules and curves used to identify disequilibrium prices and shortages (demand exceeding supply) and surpluses (supply exceeding demand)

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand changing market conditions as causes of price changes

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: use demand and supply diagrams to illustrate changes in market conditions and their consequences for equilibrium price and sales

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain the definition of PED

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: calculate PED using the formula and interpret the significance of the result

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: draw and interpret demand curve diagrams to show different PED

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the key influences on whether demand is elastic or inelastic

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the relationship between PED and total spending on a product/revenue; both in a diagram and as a calculation

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the implications for decision making by consumers; producers and government

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain the definition of PES

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: calculate PES using the formula and interpret the significance of the result

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: draw and interpret supply curve diagrams to show different PES

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the key influences on whether supply is elastic or inelastic

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the implications for decision making by consumers; producers and government

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain the definition of market economic system

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the advantages and disadvantages of the market economic system including examples of how it works in a variety of different countries

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain the key terms associated with market failure: public good; merit good; demerit good; social benefits; external benefits; private benefits; social costs; external costs; private costs

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the causes of market failure with respect to public goods; merit and demerit goods; external costs and external benefits; abuse of monopoly power and factor immobility

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the consequences of market failure in respect of the over consumption of demerit goods and goods with external costs; and the under consumption of merit goods and goods with external benefits

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain the definition of the mixed economic system

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand government microeconomic policy measures: maximum and minimum prices in product; labour and foreign exchange markets; indirect taxation; and subsidies

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the implications of other government microeconomic policy measures: regulation; privatisation and nationalisation; and direct provision of goods

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the effectiveness of government intervention in overcoming the drawbacks of a market economic system

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the forms; functions and characteristics of money

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the role and importance of central banks and commercial banks for government; producers and consumers

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the influences on spending; saving and borrowing – between different households and over time

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand wage and non-wage factors affecting an individual's choice of occupation

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the influences of demand and supply; relative bargaining power and government policy on wage determination

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand how changes in demand and supply; relative bargaining strengths; discrimination and government policy can influence differences in earnings between workers whether they are: skilled/unskilled; primary/secondary/tertiary; male/female; private sector/public sector

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the advantages and disadvantages of division of labour/specialisation for workers; firms and the economy

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain the definition of a trade union

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the role of trade unions in the economy including engaging in collective bargaining on wages; working hours and working conditions; protecting employment; and influencing government policy

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the advantages and disadvantages of trade union activity from the viewpoint of workers; firms and the government

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the classification of firms in terms of primary/secondary/tertiary sectors and private/public sector; and the relative size of firms

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the advantages and disadvantages of small firms; the challenges facing small firms and reasons for their existence

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the causes and forms of the growth of firms including internal growth; for example increased market share; and external growth; for example mergers

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand examples; advantages and disadvantages of different types of mergers: horizontal; vertical; and conglomerate

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand how internal and external economies and diseconomies of scale can affect a firm/industry as the scale of production changes

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand influences on the demand for factors of production including demand for the product; the price of different factors of production; their availability and their productivity

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the reasons for adopting labour-intensive and capital-intensive production and their advantages and disadvantages

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the difference between; and influences on; production and productivity

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and define total cost (TC); average total cost (ATC); fixed cost (FC); variable cost (VC); average fixed cost (AFC); average variable cost (AVC)

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: calculate TC; ATC; FC; VC; AFC and AVC and interpret diagrams that show how changes in output affect costs of production

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and define total revenue (TR) and average revenue (AR)

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: calculate TR and AR and understand the influence of sales on revenue

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand firm objectives including survival; social welfare; profit maximisation and growth

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the effect of having a high number of firms on price; quality; choice; profit

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the characteristics; advantages and disadvantages of monopoly markets

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the role of government locally; nationally and internationally

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand government macroeconomic aims including economic growth; full employment/low unemployment; stable prices/low inflation; balance of payments stability; redistribution of income

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand possible conflicts between macroeconomic aims: full employment versus stable prices; economic growth versus balance of payments stability; and full employment versus balance of payments stability

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and define the government budget

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the main areas of government spending and the reasons for and effects of spending in these areas

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand taxation as the main source of government revenue and the reasons for levying taxation

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand examples of the different classifications of tax; progressive; regressive; proportional; and direct; indirect

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the qualities of a good tax

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the impact of taxation on consumers; producers; government and economy as a whole

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and define fiscal policy

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the tax and spending changes; in the form of fiscal policy; that cause budget balance or imbalance

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand how fiscal policy measures may enable the government to achieve its macroeconomic aims

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and define money supply and monetary policy

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand changes in interest rates; money supply and foreign exchange rates as monetary policy measures

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand how monetary policy measures may enable the government to achieve its macroeconomic aims

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and define supply-side policy

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand possible supply-side policy measures including education and training; labour market reforms; lower direct taxes; deregulation; improving incentives to work and invest; and privatisation

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand how supply-side policy measures may enable the government to achieve its macroeconomic aims

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and define economic growth

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand real Gross Domestic Product (GDP) and how it can be used to measure economic growth

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the meaning of recession and how a recession moves the economy within its PPC

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand how changes in total demand may increase the utilisation of resources and GDP – resulting in a movement from inside toward the PPC

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand how economic growth shifts the economy's PPC to the right and is caused by changes in investment; technology; and the quantity and quality of the factors of production

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the costs and benefits of economic growth in the context of different economies

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the range of policies available to promote economic growth and how effective they might be

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and define employment; unemployment and full employment

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the nature and causes of changes in the pattern of employment; for example increase in proportion of workers employed in the tertiary sector and formal economy as an economy develops

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand how unemployment is measured through claimant count and labour force survey and the formula for the unemployment rate

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand frictional; structural and cyclical unemployment

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the consequences of unemployment for the individual; firms and the economy as a whole

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the range of policies available to reduce unemployment and how effective they might be

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and define inflation and deflation

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the measurement of inflation and deflation using the Consumer Prices Index (CPI)

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the causes of inflation: demand-pull and cost-push

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the causes of deflation: demand-side and supply-side

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the consequences of inflation and deflation for consumers; workers; savers; lenders; firms and the economy as a whole

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the range of policies available to control inflation and deflation and how effective they might be

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand real GDP per head and the Human Development Index (HDI) as indicators of living standards

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the components of real GDP and HDI and their advantages and disadvantages

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand reasons for differences in living standards and income distribution within and between countries

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and explain the difference between absolute and relative poverty

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the causes of poverty including unemployment; low wages; illness and age

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand policies to alleviate poverty and redistribute income including those promoting economic growth; improved education; more generous state benefits; progressive taxation; and national minimum wage

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the factors that affect population growth including birth rate; death rate; net migration; immigration and emigration

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand how and why birth rates; death rates and net migration vary between countries

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the concept of an optimum population and the effects of increases and decreases in population size and changes in the age and gender distribution of population

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Topic: 5.4 Differences in economic development between countries
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the causes and impacts of differences in income; productivity; population growth; size of primary; secondary and tertiary sectors; saving and investment; education; and healthcare

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the basis for specialisation at national level in broad terms of: superior resource allocation and/or cheaper production methods

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the advantages and disadvantages of specialisation at a national level for consumers; firms and the economy

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and define globalisation

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the role of multinational companies (MNCs) and their costs and benefits to host and home countries

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the benefits of free trade for consumers; producers and the economy in a variety of countries

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand methods of protection including tariffs; import quotas; subsidies and embargoes

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand reasons for protection including infant industry; declining industry; strategic industry and avoidance of dumping

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the effectiveness of protection and its impact on the home country and its trading partners

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and define foreign exchange rates including floating and fixed systems

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the demand for and supply of a currency in the foreign exchange market and the determination of the equilibrium foreign exchange rate

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the causes of foreign exchange rate fluctuations including changes in demand for exports and imports; changes in the rate of interest; speculation; and the entry or departure of MNCs

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the effects of foreign exchange rate fluctuations on export and import prices and spending on imports and exports via the PED

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the difference between; and the advantages and disadvantages of; a floating foreign exchange rate and a fixed foreign exchange rate system

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Topic: 6.4 Current account of balance of payments
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the components of the current account of the balance of payments – trade in goods; trade in services; primary income and secondary income

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Topic: 6.4 Current account of balance of payments
lessons.Learning Objective: calculate deficits and surpluses on the current account of the balance of payments and its component sections

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Topic: 6.4 Current account of balance of payments
lessons.Learning Objective: understand reasons for deficits and surpluses on the current account

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Topic: 6.4 Current account of balance of payments
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the impact of current account deficit and surplus on GDP; employment; inflation and foreign exchange rate

lessons.Subject: Economics
lessons.Topic: 6.4 Current account of balance of payments
lessons.Learning Objective: understand the range of policies available to achieve balance of payments stability and how effective they might be

lessons.Subject: English as a Second Language

lessons.Subject: English as a Second Language
lessons.Learning Objective: identify and understand ideas; opinions and attitudes; in a range of texts and the connections between them

lessons.Subject: English as a Second Language
lessons.Learning Objective: understand what is implied but not directly stated

lessons.Subject: English as a Second Language
lessons.Learning Objective: select relevant details when reading for a specific purpose

lessons.Learning Objective: communicate factual information; ideas and arguments clearly and with expansion

lessons.Subject: English as a Second Language
lessons.Learning Objective: produce written texts that show control of language

lessons.Learning Objective: select and organise relevant information and ideas into coherent text using appropriate linking devices

lessons.Learning Objective: produce written texts with a range of grammatical and lexical structures

lessons.Learning Objective: respond to a written stimulus and use appropriate register; style and format for the given purpose and audience

lessons.Learning Objective: identify and understand factual detail and specific information in a range of spoken contexts and from a variety of sources

lessons.Learning Objective: show understanding of the connections between ideas; opinions; feelings and attitudes in a range of spoken contexts and from a variety of sources

lessons.Learning Objective: show understanding of what is implied but not directly stated

lessons.Learning Objective: communicate factual information; ideas and opinions with expansion

lessons.Learning Objective: produce coherent and relevant responses

lessons.Learning Objective: engage in different types of interaction (e.g.; conversation; short talk; interview)

lessons.Learning Objective: produce responses using a range of grammatical and lexical structures

lessons.Subject: English as a Second Language
lessons.Learning Objective: communicate showing control of pronunciation and intonation

lessons.Learning Objective: summarise and use material for a specific context

lessons.Learning Objective: demonstrate understanding of how writers achieve their effects and influence readers

lessons.Learning Objective: recognise and respond to linguistic devices; figurative language and imagery

lessons.Learning Objective: express what is thought; felt and imagined

lessons.Learning Objective: organise and convey facts; ideas and opinions effectively

lessons.Learning Objective: demonstrate a varied vocabulary appropriate to the context

lessons.Learning Objective: demonstrate an effective use of sentence structures

lessons.Learning Objective: demonstrate an understanding of audience; purpose and form

lessons.Subject: English First Language
lessons.Learning Objective: demonstrate accuracy in spelling; punctuation and grammar

lessons.Subject: English First Language
lessons.Learning Objective: describe and reflect on experience; and express what is thought; felt and imagined

lessons.Subject: English First Language
lessons.Learning Objective: organise and convey facts; ideas and opinions effectively

lessons.Subject: English First Language
lessons.Learning Objective: understand and convey complex ideas

lessons.Learning Objective: communicate with clarity; focus and purpose

lessons.Learning Objective: communicate appropriately for the context
